title: Giuliani seeking defense attorney: report
text:
President Trump Donald John TrumpSchedule for additional depositions in impeachment inquiry revealed Sondland attorney disputes key portions of Taylor testimony: report Impeachment inquiry might be public by mid-November: report MORE's personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani Rudy GiulianiTrump's new challenge is officials dishing dirt Budowsky: Trump presidency in mortal peril Graham nixes plan to send Pelosi letter warning GOP won't convict Trump MORE is talking to defense lawyers and may seek representation, according to a report by CNN.

CNN cited three sources familiar with the matter in the report, which said that the former New York City mayor at the center of the impeachment inquiry has been approaching defense lawyers about possibly representing him.

ADVERTISEMENT

Giuliani did not directly comment to CNN about whether he was or would look for a defense attorney but said he had not been contacted by the FBI, Southern District of New York attorneys or any other lawyer related to the controversy surrounding his work for Trump in Ukraine.

He said in a Wednesday night tweet that "everything I did was to discover evidence to defend my client against false charges."

With all the Fake News let me make it clear that everything I did was to discover evidence to defend my client against false charges.Dems would be horrified by the attacks on me, if my client was a terrorist.But they don’t believe @realDonaldTrump has rights. Justice will prevail — Rudy Giuliani (@RudyGiuliani) October 24, 2019

Several witnesses have testified as part of the impeachment inquiry that they were uncomfortable about Giuliani's efforts on behalf of Trump.

Giuliani appeared to be looking for information on former Vice President Joe Biden Joe BidenImpeachment inquiry might be public by mid-November: report The Memo: GOP schisms deepen as Trump impeachment pressure rises Graham nixes plan to send Pelosi letter warning GOP won't convict Trump MORE and his son Hunter's work in Ukraine and wanted Ukraine's government to open investigations into the Bidens.

The U.S. envoy to Ukraine in explosive testimony on Tuesday said he believed military aid to Ukraine had been withheld as leverage to get Kiev to launch investigations related to the 2016 U.S. presidential election and the Bidens. The diplomat, William Taylor, believed Trump knew of the link.

Other officials have offered testimony about concerns over Giuliani's shadow diplomacy effort in Ukraine, with two officials saying former national security adviser John Bolton John BoltonImpeachment inquiry might be public by mid-November: report Trump's new challenge is officials dishing dirt Former Nunes staffer fueled Trump's Ukrainian corruption claims: report MORE specifically raised concerns.

Giuliani said last week that he would not search for a new lawyer unless he felt like he needed one, according to CNN.

"If they take me to court I would then have to get another lawyer," he told the news network.

The New York Times reported earlier this month that federal prosecutors are investigating whether Giuliani's dealings with Ukraine violated lobbying laws. Giuliani said at the time that he was unaware of any such probe.

He has also been subpoenaed as part of a House impeachment inquiry into Trump, but his attorney Jon Sale said he would not comply.

Two of Giuliani's associates have also been arrested on campaign finance violation charges this month. They have pleaded not guilty.
description: President Trump's personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani is talking to defense lawyers and may seek representation, according to a report by CNN.
